title: [K-12] Blended Methodology-Based Social Studies Instructional Design Workshop for Transitioning to Online Education: Enhancing Citizenship and Social Context

context.prior_knowledge: Offline education program management experience, basic digital tool proficiency, understanding of core social studies concepts (history/geography/politics/economics), foundational grasp of citizenship and social relationship development
context.additional_context: Strengthening practical instructional design competencies based on post-COVID-19 online education transition experiences. Special focus is placed on developing blended learning models reflecting social studies characteristics (cultivating citizenship, critical thinking, cultural understanding). Includes strategies for community issue-solving projects, digital citizenship education, and inclusive learning environment construction.

learning_goals: Learners design one school life-related survey within a week and present analysis results reflecting learner needs and social contexts (e.g., digital device usage habits, peer relationships, civic competency development) in three or more of five questions

Learners create a blended learning (online/offline integrated) one-period social studies lesson plan within a week, achieving 'B grade' or higher in three of four evaluation criteria (objectives, content, methods, assessment), with particular emphasis on designing activities that promote cultural understanding and critical thinking

Propose collaboration system-building plans among instructors during educational transitions and develop practical strategies for strengthening civic education: incorporating community engagement, multicultural understanding, and democratic decision-making processes
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
